Identification.LongTitle: Regulations Respecting the Registration of Establishments, the Operation and Maintenance of Registered Establishments, the Grading, Inspection, Packing and Labelling of Dairy Products and International and Interprovincial Trade in Dairy Products

Provision.Text: His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Agriculture, is pleased hereby to revoke the Canada Dairy Products Regulations C.R.C., c. 533 and, pursuant to sections 3, 5 and 8 and subsection 10(4) of the Canada Agricultural Products Standards Act, to make the annexed Regulations respecting the grading, packing, marking and inspection of dairy products and international and interprovincial trade in dairy products in substitution therefor.

Section.Text: These Regulations may be cited as the Dairy Products Regulations.
In these Regulations,

Definition.Text: acceptable method means a method of analysis or examination designated by the Minister as acceptable for use in the administration of the Act and these Regulations; (méthode acceptable)

acid-type whey powder means whey powder that results from the drying of cottage cheese whey or cream cheese whey and that contains not less than 0.30 per cent acid by weight; (lactosérum acide en poudre)
Act means the Canada Agricultural Products Act; (Loi)
Agency means the Canadian Food Inspection Agency established by section 3 of the Canadian Food Inspection Agency Act; (Agence)

blended skim milk and whey powder or blended whey and skim milk powder means a combination of skim milk powder and whey powder; (mélange de lait écrémé et de lactosérum en poudre ou mélange de lactosérum et de lait écrémé en poudre)
butter product means calorie-reduced butter, dairy spread, light butter (lite butter) and whey butter; (produit du beurre)
buttermilk powder means buttermilk in powder form; (babeurre en poudre)
certificate of inspection means a certificate of inspection issued by the Agency; (certificat d’inspection)

commercial sterility means the condition obtained in a dairy product that has been processed by the application of heat alone or in combination with other treatments, to render the dairy product free from viable forms of micro-organisms, including spores, that would be capable of growing in the dairy product at normal temperatures at which the dairy product is designed to be held during distribution and storage; (stérilité commerciale)
common name means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product for which a standard is established by the Food and Drug Regulations, the common name of the product within the meaning of those Regulations,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product for which a standard is prescribed by these Regulations, the common name prescribed by these Regulations, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, the name by which the product is generally known; (nom usuel)

Definition.Text: contaminated, in respect of a dairy product, means containing, for any reason whatsoever, a chemical, drug, food additive, heavy metal, industrial pollutant, ingredient, medicament, microbe, pesticide, poison, toxin or any other substance not permitted by, or in an amount in excess of limits prescribed under, or regulated by the Canadian Environmental Protection Act, 1999, the Food and Drugs Act and the Pest Control Products Act; (contaminé)
country of origin, with respect to a dairy product, means the country in which the product was manufactured or the country in which the product last received significant processing; (pays d’origine)
critical factors means the physical and chemical factors that affect the capability of the thermal process to achieve commercial sterility in a dairy product; (facteurs critiques)
dairy product means milk or a product thereof, whether alone or combined with another agricultural product, that contains no oil or fat other than that of milk; (produit laitier)
Director means the Director designated by the President of the Agency; (directeur)
edible means fit for use as food; (version anglaise seulement)
edible casein means the dry product obtained by separating, washing and drying the coagulum of skim milk, where the coagulum is obtained by precipitation with a food grade acid; (caséine comestible)

edible caseinate means the dry product obtained by the reaction of a food grade neutralizing agent on edible casein or fresh edible casein curd, the product of which is then subjected to an appropriate drying treatment; (caséinate comestible)
food has the same meaning as in section 2 of the Food and Drugs Act; (aliment)
food additive has the same meaning as in section B.01.001 of Part B of the Food and Drug Regulations; (additif alimentaire)
formulation means, in respect of a dairy product,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its ingredients and components, including food additives, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the relative proportions of its ingredients and components; (formulation)

Definition.Text: further processing means further treating a dairy product or subjecting it to heat, either alone or in the process of being used as an ingredient in food manufacturing; (transformation ultérieure)
hermetically sealed container means a container that is designed to be secure against the entry of micro-organisms, including spores; (récipient hermétiquement fermé)
ingredient means an individual unit of food that is combined with one or more other individual units of food to form an integral unit of food; (ingrédient)
instant, with respect to a dried milk product, means a dried milk product that has been processed to significantly improve dispersability and solubility; (instantané)
low-acid dairy product means a dairy product any component of which has a pH value above 4.6 and a water activity (Aw) above 0.85; (produit laitier peu acide)
M means one million (1,000,000); (M)
milk or whole milk, as used in the manufacture of dairy products, means the normal lacteal secretion, free from colostrum, obtained from the mammary gland of an animal; (lait ou lait entier)
milk fat or butter fat, in the case of fat from cow’s milk, means fat from cow’s milk that meets the requirements of section B.08.006 of the Food and Drug Regulations; (matière grasse du lait)
milk product means any of the following, namely,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: partly skimmed milk, skim milk, cream, buttermilk, whey and whey cream,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: milk in concentrated, dried, frozen or reconstituted form and any product referred to in paragraph (a) in concentrated, dried, frozen or reconstituted form,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: butter, butter oil and whey butter,

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: milk solids, and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: whey protein concentrate; (produit du lait)

Definition.Text: milk solids means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a dairy product, other than cheese, for which a grade or standard is established under these Regulations, any constituent of milk — other than water or casein — singly or in combination with other constituents of milk, that has not been altered in its chemical composition, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of cheese, any constituent of milk — other than water — singly or in combination with other constituents of milk; (solides du lait)

Definition.Text: Minister means the Minister of Agriculture and Agri-Food; (ministre)
mix for frozen dairy products means ice cream mix, light ice cream mix, ice milk mix and frozen dairy dessert mix; (mélange à produit laitier glacé)
operator means the person who is responsible for the operation of a registered establishment; (exploitant)

packaged cheese means the product resulting from the comminuting and mixing of one or more lots of cheese with the aid of heat or emulsifying agents, and includes prepackaged cream cheese and prepackaged cream cheese products, prepackaged grated cheese and prepackaged grated cheese product; (fromage sous contenant)

packed in bulk, with respect to a dairy product, means a dairy product that has been placed directly into a container for the purpose of storing, shipping or marketing where the product is not ordinarily sold to or used or purchased by a consumer without being repackaged; (emballé en vrac)
partly-skimmed milk powder means partly-skimmed milk in powder form; (lait partiellement écrémé en poudre)

pasteurized, with respect to a dairy product, means that the product or that the milk product from which it was made was subjected, under controlled conditions, to heat at a temperature and for a time sufficient to destroy all of the pathogenic types of micro-organisms and most of the other organisms present; (pasteurisé)
permitted, with respect to food additives, sweetening agents or vitamins, means permitted or authorized by the Food and Drug Regulations; (autorisé)
permitted bacterial culture means a bacterial culture that meets the requirements of section B.08.050 of the Food and Drug Regulations; (culture bactérienne autorisée)

prepackaged, with respect to a dairy product, means a dairy product that is packaged in a container in such a manner that it is ordinarily sold to or used or purchased by a consumer without being repackaged; (préemballé)
prepared or preserved meat means a meat product prepared or preserved in accordance with the Meat Inspection Act and Regulations made thereunder; (viande préparée ou conservée)

principal display panel and principal display surface have the meanings set out for those terms in section 2 of the Consumer Packaging and Labelling Regulations; (espace principal et principale surface exposée)
registered establishment means an establishment that is registered in accordance with section 10; (établissement agréé)
registration number means the number assigned to a registered establishment under section 10; (numéro d’agrément)

scheduled process means the thermal process alone, or in combination with critical factors, chosen by an operator for a particular dairy product formulation, container type and size and unit of thermal processing equipment, that will achieve commercial sterility in the dairy product; (traitement programmé)
seasoning means a condiment, spice or herb used to savour, but does not include salt; (assaisonnement)
skim milk powder (dry skim milk) means skim milk in powder form; (lait écrémé en poudre)
spray-dried, with respect to a dried milk product, means a dried milk product produced by a spray drying process; (desséché par pulvérisation)

ultrafiltered, in relation to milk, partly skimmed milk or skim milk, means that the milk, partly skimmed milk or skim milk has been subjected to a process in which it is passed over one or more semi-permeable membranes to partially remove water, lactose, minerals and water-soluble vitamins without altering the whey protein to casein ratio and that results in a liquid product. (ultrafiltré)
water activity means the ratio of the water vapour pressure of a dairy product to the vapour pressure of pure water at the same temperature and pressure; (activité de l’eau)
whey powder means whey in powder form; (lactosérum en poudre)
whole milk powder means whole milk in powder form. (lait entier en poudre)

Section.Text: Where a grade or standard is established under these Regulations for a dairy product, no person shall market any product in import, export or interprovincial trade in such a manner that the product is likely to be mistaken for the dairy product.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), no person shall market a dairy product in import, export or interprovincial trade as food unless the dairy product

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is not contaminated;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is edible;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: is prepared in a sanitary manner; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: meets all other requirements of the Food and Drugs Act and the Food and Drug Regulations with respect to the dairy product.

Subsection.Text: A dairy product that has been contaminated may be marketed in export or interprovincial trade as food where the dairy product, before being marketed, is prepared in such a manner that it meets the requirements of paragraphs (1)(b) to (e).

No person shall, for the purpose of preparing a dairy product referred to in subsection (2) in such a manner that it meets the requirements of paragraphs (1)(b) to (e), mix the dairy product with a dairy product that is not contaminated.
For the purpose of paragraph (1)(d), prepared in a sanitary manner means prepared in accordance with section 11.1.

Section.Text: A dairy product that is contaminated may be marketed in import, export or interprovincial trade as animal food if it is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: fit for use as animal food;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: labelled with the words “Animal Food” or “Aliments pour animaux” or the words “For Animal Feed” or “Pour alimentation animale”;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: prepared separately from dairy products intended for use as food; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: where appropriate, treated to give it the appearance of being inedible.

Section.Text: An inspector may direct that a dairy product be disposed of or destroyed where the inspector suspects on reasonable grounds that the dairy product

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is contaminated;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: does not meet the requirements of subsection 2.2(1) or section 2.3 and cannot be prepared in such a manner that it meets those requirements; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: is otherwise injurious to the health of any person.

Subsection.Text: The grade and grade name for butter, butter products and cheddar cheese is Canada 1.
The grades and grade names for dry milk products are Canada 1 and Canada 2.

Section.Text: A dairy product may be graded only if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it meets the appropriate standards set out in section 6 for the particular product;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: it meets the requirements for a grade set out in this Part;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: it meets the requirements of the Food and Drugs Act and Regulations thereunder;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: it is free from any contaminating substances;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: it contains no toxic substances;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: it is undamaged and uncontaminated by vermin;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: it is free from salmonella and listeria monocytogenic organisms, as determined by acceptable methods; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: it does not exceed the permitted level of coliforms.

Heading.TitleText: Standards for Butter, Butter Products and Cheddar Cheese

Subsection.Text: Butter and butter products the common names of which are set out in Column I of the items of the table to this subsection shall meet the following standards:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: they shall be the foods prepared in accordance with good manufacturing practices from pasteurized milk or pasteurized milk products;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: they shall contain milk fat and, where applicable, calories in the percentages set out in Column II of an item of that table; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: they may contain only those permitted ingredients that are set out in column III of an item of that table.

row.entry: Percentage of Milk Fat and Calories
Milk solids, salt, air or inert gas, permitted food colour, permitted bacterial culture
Minimum 80% milk fat, recovered from whey, by weight
Milk solids, salt, air or inert gas, permitted food colour, permitted bacterial culture
Minimum 39% milk fat by weight; maximum 60% milk fat by weight
Milk solids, salt, air or inert gas, permitted food colour, permitted bacterial culture
Maximum 39% milk fat by weight; maximum 50% of calories of butter

Milk solids, salt, air or inert gas, permitted food colour, permitted emulsifying and stabilizing agents, permitted preservative, permitted bacterial culture, up to 1% added edible casein or edible caseinates
Minimum 39% milk fat by weight; maximum 80% milk fat by weight

Milk solids, salt, air or inert gas, permitted food colour, permitted emulsifying and stabilizing agents, permitted preservative, permitted bacterial culture, up to 1% added edible casein or edible caseinates

Subsection.Text: Butter and butter products shall be designated as

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “whipped” where they have had air or inert gas uniformly incorporated into them as a result of whipping; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “cultured” where they have been produced from cream to which a permitted bacterial culture has been added.

Subsection.Text: Whipped butter may contain up to one per cent added edible casein or edible caseinates.

Cheddar cheese shall be the product made by coagulating milk, milk products or a combination thereof with the aid of bacteria to form a curd and subjecting the curd to the cheddar process or any process other than the cheddar process that produces a cheese having the same physical, chemical and organoleptic properties as those of cheese produced by the cheddar process, and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 39 per cent moisture, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 31 per cent milk fat;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: bacterial cultures to aid in further ripening,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: permitted firming agents,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: permitted preservatives, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: permitted food colour;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall have

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a casein content that is derived from milk or from ultrafiltered milk, partly skimmed milk, ultrafiltered partly skimmed milk, skim milk, ultrafiltered skim milk or cream, rather than from other milk products, that is at least 83 per cent of the total protein content of the cheese, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a whey protein to casein ratio that does not exceed the whey protein to casein ratio of milk; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall not be designated as cheddar cheese that has been aged unless

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it is made solely with milk, ultrafiltered milk, partly skimmed milk, ultrafiltered partly skimmed milk, skim milk, ultrafiltered skim milk or cream or a combination of those things, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: it has been aged for at least nine months and the period for which it has been aged is specified on the principal display panel of the label of the product.

Subsection.Text: Cheddar cheese may contain more than the maximum percentage of moisture set out in subparagraph (3)(a)(i) and less than the minimum percentage of milk fat set out in subparagraph (3)(a)(ii) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement or claim set out in column 4 of any of items 12 to 14, 16, 20, 21 and 45 of the table following section B.01.513 of the Food and Drug Regulations is shown on the label of the product as part of the common name; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the cheese has the characteristic flavour and texture of cheddar cheese.

Subsection.Text: The reference to “83 per cent” in subparagraph (3)(c)(i) shall be read as “78 per cent” if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement or claim set out in column 4 of any of items 12 to 14, 16, 20, 21 and 45 of the table following section B.01.513 of the Food and Drug Regulations is shown on the label of the product as part of the common name; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the cheese has the characteristic flavour and texture of cheddar cheese.

Section.Text: A dairy product shall be graded only if it was prepared in a registered establishment that at the time of the preparation met the requirements of sections 11 and 11.1.

Subsection.Text: An application for the registration of an establishment, or for the renewal or amendment of an existing registration, shall be made to the Director, in a form provided by the Agency, accompanied by the applicable fee prescribed by the Canadian Food Inspection Agency Fees Notice, and shall contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address, including the postal code, telephone number and, if any, facsimile number of the applicant and of the establishment, where they are different from those of the applicant;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: whether it is an application for a new registration or for the renewal or amendment of an existing registration;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the existing registration number, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: whether the establishment is owned by an individual, a partnership, a cooperative or a corporation;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name under which the establishment operates, where the name is different from that of the applicant;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the names and titles of all owners, partners, officers and directors of the establishment; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: an estimate of the volume of milk that the establishment will receive or the quantity of dairy products that the establishment will produce during the 12 months following the date of application.

Subsection.Text: An application referred to in subsection (1) shall have annexed thereto

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: plans and specifications for the establishment that shall include

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the dimensions and intended uses of the rooms and the positions of doors, windows, stairways and drains,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: descriptions of the lighting, refrigeration, ventilation and plumbing systems,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: descriptions of the types and location of equipment to be used in the establishment,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: descriptions of the materials used in the construction of equipment, floors, walls, ceilings and openings, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: descriptions of the location of the establishment in relation to adjacent buildings, roads, railways, waterways and public utilities; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of an outline of a sanitation program for the establishment, indicating

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person responsible for carrying out the program,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the equipment and chemical agents available for use to bring about and maintain clean and sanitary conditions, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the measures proposed to be taken to ensure clean and sanitary conditions.

Subsection.Text: Where an establishment in respect of which an application referred to in subsection (1) is made meets the conditions set out in section 11, the Director shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: register the establishment by entering its name in the register of registered establishments of the Agency and by assigning it a registration number; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: issue a Certificate of Registration to the person operating the establishment.

Subsection.Text: The operator shall post the Certificate of Registration issued to the operator under subsection (3) in a conspicuous place in the registered establishment for the period during which the Certificate remains in force.
The operator shall not assign or transfer the Certificate of Registration issued in respect of that establishment.
Subject to sections 10.1 and 10.2, a Certificate of Registration is valid until the expiry date stated on the Certificate.
The Director may suspend the registration of a registered establishment

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: where

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the establishment does not meet the requirements of the Act or these Regulations, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the operator does not comply with the provisions of the Act or these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is reasonable to believe that public health will be endangered if the establishment is allowed to continue operating; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the operator has failed or is unable to take immediate corrective measures to remedy any situation referred to in paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: No registration shall be suspended under subsection (1) unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an inspector has, at the time of the inspection, notified the operator of the failure to comply with any provision of the Act or these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an inspector has provided the operator with a copy of an inspection report prepared by the inspector that sets out the grounds for suspension, the required corrective measures and the dates by which those measures must be implemented in order to avoid suspension and cancellation; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a notice of suspension of registration is delivered to the operator.

Subsection.Text: A suspension of a registration under subsection (1) shall remain in effect

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: until the required corrective measures have been taken and have been verified by an inspector; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where a cancellation procedure has been commenced under section 10.2, until the resolution of the cancellation issue.

Subsection.Text: The Director may cancel the registration of a registered establishment where

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the operator has not implemented the required corrective measures within the 30-day period following the day on which the registration was suspended or within any longer period of time allowed under subsection (2);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the owner or operator of the establishment has changed; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the application for registration contains false or misleading information.

Subsection.Text: If it is not possible for the operator to implement the required corrective measures within 30 days, the Director shall, on the request of the operator, allow the operator a longer period of time that is adequate to implement those measures.
No registration shall be cancelled under subsection (1) unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the operator was advised of an opportunity to be heard in respect of the cancellation and was given that opportunity; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a notice of cancellation of registration was delivered to the operator.

Subsection.Text: Every registered establishment shall be situated on land that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is free from debris and refuse;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provides or permits good drainage; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is not in proximity to any source of pollution or any place that harbours insects, birds, rodents or other vermin that are likely to contaminate dairy products in the establishment.

Subsection.Text: Every registered establishment shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be of sound construction and in good repair;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be constructed of material that is durable and free from any noxious constituent;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: be separate from and have no direct access to living quarters, livestock housing and areas in which operations are incompatible with the handling of a dairy product;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: be protected against the entry of insects, birds, rodents or other vermin or any thing that is likely to contaminate dairy products;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: have, where an exposed dairy product is prepared, floors, walls and ceilings that are

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: of a hard finish that is suitable for cleaning,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: smooth,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: impervious to moisture,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: free from pitting, indentations, cracks, crevices and ledges, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of floors, sloped for adequate drainage;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: have rooms and areas that have adequate lighting, ventilation and plumbing to meet the requirements of the operations carried out in those rooms and areas and that are constructed so as to facilitate the cleaning and disinfection of those rooms and areas;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: be equipped, in those areas where dairy products, ingredients, food additives or packing materials are exposed, with light bulbs and fixtures that are of a type that will not cause dairy product contamination in the event of breakage;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: have a sufficient number of rooms to accommodate the separation of incompatible operations;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: have, if dairy products are graded therein, a room for this purpose that is adequate in size to set out necessary samples;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: have dressing rooms, lunch rooms and lavatories that are

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: capable of being kept in a clean and sanitary condition,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: adequate in size and equipment for the number of people using them,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: well lighted and ventilated, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of lavatories, separate from and not leading directly into any room used for handling a dairy product;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subsection (3), be supplied with potable hot and cold water that is protected against contamination and is adequate in quantity and pressure to serve the water needs of the establishment;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: have adequate means of waste removal and disposal;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: have drainage and sewage systems that are

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in accordance with the plumbing code of the province in which the establishment is located,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: adequate to handle all wastes,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: equipped with traps and vents,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: designed and constructed so that there is no cross- connection between the effluent of human wastes and any other wastes in the establishment, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: designed and constructed in a manner that prevents the contamination of a dairy product;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: have, for the preparation of a dairy product, equipment that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: constructed of corrosion-resistant material, free of any noxious constituent and capable of being cleaned,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: accessible for cleaning, maintenance and inspection or easily disassembled for those purposes, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: effective for the purpose for which it is intended;

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: have food contact surfaces that are

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: non-toxic,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: smooth,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: free from pitting, crevices and loose scale,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: unaffected by dairy products,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: capable of withstanding repeated exposure to normal cleaning, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: non-absorbent;

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: have adequate facilities and means for the thorough washing, cleaning and sanitizing of equipment;

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: be equipped with appropriate container cleaning equipment; and

Paragraph.Label: (r)
Paragraph.Text: be equipped with adequate means of establishing, maintaining and verifying the temperature and humidity of rooms in which dairy products are located.

Subsection.Text: A registered establishment may use water other than potable water referred to in paragraph (2)(k) where it is used solely for fire protection, boilers or auxiliary services and there is no connection between the system for that water and the system for potable water.

Heading.TitleText: Operation and Maintenance of Registered Establishments

Subsection.Text: Every operator shall operate and maintain the establishment in accordance with this section.
The building, equipment, utensils and all other physical facilities of a registered establishment shall be maintained in a sanitary condition.
Every registered establishment shall be operated in accordance with the outline of the sanitation program referred to in paragraph 10(2)(b).
Operations in relation to the preparation of a dairy product in a registered establishment shall be carried out under stringent sanitary control.
Notices shall be posted in prominent places in a registered establishment

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: instructing employees engaged in the preparation of any dairy product to clean their hands immediately after using toilet facilities;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: indicating that smoking is prohibited; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: prohibiting food, other than that used in the preparation of a dairy product, and drink in food preparation areas.

Subsection.Text: In a registered establishment, no material or coating shall be used to repair the floors, walls, ceilings, doors, windows and other parts of any room or area in which dairy products are prepared unless the material or coating is durable and free from any noxious constituent.
Refuse shall be removed at least once daily from within a registered establishment.
In a registered establishment, the minimum illumination at the working area, when measured at a distance of 75 cm from the floor, shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of processing and equipment cleaning areas, 330 1x; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of rooms used for grading or inspection purposes, 550 1x.

Subsection.Text: All lavatories, sinks and drains in a registered establishment shall be maintained in a manner that prevents any odours or fumes therefrom from pervading any room in which dairy products are prepared.
The operator shall maintain an effective and safe rodent and insect control program and shall exclude any animal from the establishment.

Any detergent, sanitizer or other chemical agent in a registered establishment shall be properly labelled and shall be stored and used in a manner that prevents the contamination of dairy products or a dairy product contact surface.
Container cleaning equipment in a registered establishment shall be operated in a manner that ensures that containers used for dairy products, when cleaned, are free from foreign material.
A room used for grading a dairy product shall be kept clean and tidy and shall be free from noise and odours that might interfere with the accurate assessment of quality.

Where steam is used in the preparation of dairy products in a registered establishment, the steam shall be generated from potable water and contain no harmful substances, and the supply of steam shall be adequate in quantity and pressure to serve the total needs of the establishment.

No dairy product or food intended for use as an ingredient in a dairy product in a registered establishment shall be maintained at a temperature and humidity that may cause that dairy product or food to deteriorate or become inedible.
No dairy product or other substance used in the preparation of a dairy product in a registered establishment shall be exposed to a source of contamination.
No dairy product shall come into contact with anything in a registered establishment that might adversely affect the quality, colour or appearance of the dairy product.
No person in a registered establishment shall use, in the preparation of a dairy product for which grades or standards are established by these Regulations,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any domestic dairy product, other than milk or cream, from any establishment that is not a registered establishment; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any milk or cream that does not meet the quality standards established for milk and cream by the appropriate provincial or federal authority.

Subsection.Text: No person in a registered establishment shall pack a dairy product that is not intended for human consumption or is inedible unless the container is prominently marked with a statement to that effect.
No operator of a registered establishment, unless authorized by the Director, shall permit any person who will be engaged in the preparation of an exposed dairy product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to begin employment in the establishment until that person produces a physician’s certificate stating that there is no medical impediment to that person’s employment in the establishment; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to continue employment in the establishment unless the person produces any other medical certificate required by the Director.

Subsection.Text: No person who suffers from or is a known carrier of a communicable disease or who has an infected lesion that is open or exposed shall work in any area of a registered establishment where there is a danger of contaminating a dairy product, an ingredient or a food contact surface with pathogenic micro-organisms.

Every person engaged in the preparation of a dairy product in a registered establishment shall clean their hands thoroughly immediately after using toilet facilities and as frequently as is necessary to prevent the contamination of a dairy product.
Every person engaged in directly handling a dairy product in a registered establishment shall clean their hands thoroughly in a sanitizing solution each time they enter the processing room.
Every person engaged in the preparation of a dairy product in a registered establishment shall wear

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sanitary clothing and a complete hair covering;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where gloves are used in the handling of a dairy product, only gloves that are made of an impermeable material and are maintained in a sound, clean and sanitary condition; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: outer clothing that is free from pockets and buttons above the waist, and footwear, neither of which is worn outside the establishment.

Subsection.Text: No person shall use tobacco in any form, chew gum or consume food of any kind, except water dispensed from a drinking fountain, in any part of a registered establishment where dairy products are prepared.
No person engaged in the preparation of a dairy product in a registered establishment shall wear an object or use a substance that may fall into or otherwise contaminate the dairy product.
Where a laboratory forms part of a registered establishment, the laboratory shall be operated so that it does not lead to the contamination of a dairy product.

The operator shall notify the Director of any proposed major modification to a registered establishment and, where requested by the Director, submit detailed plans and specifications of the modification.

Heading.TitleText: Grade Requirements for Butter and Butter Products

Subsection.Text: Butter and butter products may be graded Canada 1 if the butter or butter product meets the requirements of section 4 and subsections 6(1), (2) and (2.1), and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its flavour is typical and desirable, and in the case of cultured butter, slightly acidulous;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its texture is smooth;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: its body is firm;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: moisture in the product is reasonably well incorporated;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: its colour is uniform and characteristic of the product; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: any salt in the product is dissolved.

Subsection.Text: Cheddar cheese may be graded Canada 1 if the cheese meets the requirements of section 4 and subsection 6(3), and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its flavour and aroma are typical and desirable;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its body is reasonably compact and firm;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its texture is smooth;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its surface is clean, smooth and unbroken;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: except in the case of marbled cheddar cheese, its colour is uniform and characteristic of cheddar cheese; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the cheese is uniform in size and regular in shape.

Heading.TitleText: Grade Requirements for Dry Milk Products

Subsection.Text: A dry milk product named in the heading of a table to this section may be graded Canada 1 if it meets the requirements of section 4, and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it meets the requirements of the grade Canada 1 as set out in that table;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is uniform in composition and colour;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: it is free from hard lumps;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: it is white or cream in colour or, in the case of whey powder, acid-type whey powder, blended skim milk and whey powder and blended whey and skim milk powder, it is light in colour;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: it is wholly free from black or brown particles visible to the naked eye except in the case of whey powder, acid-type whey powder, blended skim milk and whey powder, and blended whey and skim milk powder, which shall be substantially free from brown or black particles visible to the naked eye;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: when reconstituted, its flavour and odour are unobjectionable except in the case of whey powder, acid-type whey powder, blended skim milk and whey powder and blended whey and skim milk powder, which may have a slightly cooked or slightly scorched flavour and odour; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: except in the case of acid-type whey powder, it does not contain a pH adjusting agent.

Subsection.Text: A dry milk product named in the heading of a table to this section may be graded Canada 2 if it meets the requirements of section 4, and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it meets the requirements of the grade Canada 2 as set out in that table; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it meets the requirements set out in subsection (1), except that its flavour and odour when reconstituted may lack freshness.

Subsection.Text: In the tables to this section,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: > means greater than; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: < means less than.

Footnote.Text: Except skim milk powder designated as “High Heat” (High Temp.), which shall not be greater than 2.0 ml.
Except skim milk powder designated as “High Heat” (High Temp.), which shall not be greater than 2.5 ml.
Except partly-skimmed milk powder designated as “High Heat” (High Temp.), which shall not be greater than 2.0 ml.
Calculated to atmospheric pressure. This determination to be made 7-10 days after final gas packaging.
3.5% in the case of whole milk powder that has been made more soluble by an instantizing process.
5.0% in the case of Non-Hygroscopic Whey Powder.
0.08% in the case of whey powder made from swiss cheese whey, and identified as such.
5.0% in the case of Non-Hygroscopic Whey Powder.

table.title: Blended Skim Milk and Whey Powder Blended Whey and Skim Milk Powder

Footnote.Text: 0.09% where the whey used comes from the manufacture of swiss cheese, and is identified as such.
in the case of Ca. and Mg. edible caseinates.
in the case of other edible caseinates.

Subsection.Text: Every container shall be free from objectionable odours, adequate to protect the dairy product against moisture, loss, damage, contamination or deterioration during normal handling and storage and shall be securely closed.

Any liner used in a container shall be new and, in the case of butter and butter products packed in bulk, shall consist of two layers of good quality parchment paper or a plastic film treated to prevent mould growth.

Butter and butter products shall be packaged in containers through which the direct and diffused transmission of light does not exceed two per cent in the wave-length range 300 to 400 nanometres or five per cent in the wave-length range 401 to 500 nanometres.
Every prepackaged dairy product shall be packed in accordance with good manufacturing practices in new containers that are clean and sound.
A dairy product that is packed in bulk

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be packed in accordance with good manufacturing practices; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may be packed in reusable containers if they are clean and sound.

Section.Text: Every dairy product shall be labelled in accordance with sections 18 to 23.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), any information that is required by this Part to be shown on the label of a dairy product shall be shown in a manner that is permanent and easily legible to the consumer under normal or customary conditions of sale or use, and, in the case of information referred to in Schedule III, in the letter heights set out in that Schedule.
Any information that is required by this Part to be shown on the label of a dairy product packed in bulk shall be either stamped or printed by mechanical process on the appropriate label.

Where no letter height is set out in Schedule III for information required by this Part to be marked on a prepackaged dairy product, the information shall be shown in letters not less than 1.6 millimetres (one-sixteenth of an inch) in height, except that where the principal display surface of a container is 10 square centimetres (1.55 square inches) or less, the information shall be shown in letters of not less than 0.8 millimetres (one thirty-second of an inch) in height.

Where no letter height is set out in Schedule III for information required by this Part to be marked on a dairy product packed in bulk, the information shall be shown in bold face letters that are at least 16 millimetres (five-eighths of an inch) in height, except that the information required by paragraph 19(2)(a) need only be shown in letters of a height that is sufficient so as to be legible.
Subject to subsection (4), every prepackaged dairy product shall be labelled on the principal display panel of the container with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the common name of the dairy product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a declaration of the process of manufacture shown in close proximity to the common name, in the case of any dry milk product other than edible casein;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a declaration of net contents, as required by the Consumer Packaging and Labelling Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a percentage declaration of moisture and milk fat in cheddar cheese;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a percentage declaration of milk fat in the case of partly-skimmed milk powder, dairy spread and calorie-reduced butter;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a percentage declaration of skim milk powder and whey powder in the case of blended skim milk and whey powder and blended whey and skim milk powder;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a statement as to the source of the milk, where the dairy product consists of or was manufactured wholly or partly from milk that is the normal secretion of the mammary gland of animals other than the cow and the source is not indicated in the common name;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of butter patties, butter reddies and related products having a mass net exceeding 20 grams, a declaration of the number of units or portions and the mass of each unit or portion;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the word “unsalted” in the case of unsalted butter and butter products other than cultured butter and butter products, and the word “salted” in the case of salted cultured butter and butter products, shown in close proximity to the common name;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the word “cultured” in the case of cultured butter and butter products, shown preceding the common name;

Paragraph.Label: (j.1)
Paragraph.Text: the word “whipped” in the case of whipped butter and butter products, shown preceding the common name; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the words “Product of” followed by the name of the country of origin, in the case of cheddar cheese prepackaged in Canada from imported bulk.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (4), every prepackaged dairy product shall be labelled on any surface, other than the bottom of the container, with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the list of ingredients and components thereof, as required by paragraph B.01.008(1)(b) of the Food and Drug Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the durable life date and instructions for proper storage of the dairy product, in those cases where the durable life is 90 days or less, as required by paragraph B.01.007(1.1)(b) of the Food and Drug Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the words “Product of” followed by the name of the country of origin in the case of an imported dairy product; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the words “Product of Canada” when packed for export from Canada.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (4), every prepackaged dairy product shall be labelled on any surface of the container with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a domestic dairy product, where the name and address shown on the label are not that of the actual establishment where the prepackaged dairy product was prepared,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the registration number of the establishment in which the dairy product was prepared, shown within an eight-sided frame in the same proportions as illustrated in Schedule V, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the registration number of the establishment in which the dairy product was prepared, preceded by the words “Registration Number” or the abbreviation “Reg. No.” or “Reg.”; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a batch number, code number or lot number identifying an appropriate, meaningful sized unit of production.

Subsection.Text: The labelling requirements of this section do not apply in respect of prepackaged individual portions of dairy products that are for sale from automatic vending machines or mobile canteens, or that are served by a restaurant or other commercial enterprise with meals or as snacks.
Subject to section 21, every dairy product packed in bulk shall be labelled on the principal display surface of the container with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the common name of the product;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a declaration of the process of manufacture shown in close proximity to the common name, in the case of any dry milk product other than edible casein;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the registration number within an eight-sided frame in the same proportion as illustrated in Schedule V, in the case of a domestic dairy product;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the words “churn number” or the abbreviation “ch. no.” for butter and butter products, followed by the churn number, which shall begin with the number 1 on January 1 of each calendar year and run consecutively throughout the calendar year;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of cheese, the vat number to begin with the number 1 on January 1st of each calendar year and to run consecutively throughout the calendar year;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a declaration of net contents in metric units;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a series of numbers indicating the day, month and year in which the dairy product was prepared and in the case of a dry milk product for which daily production is divided into two or three lots, the letter A, B or C to indicate the lot in which the product was prepared, shown vertically along the side of the main panel;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the word “Pasteurized” in the case of cheddar cheese still in its original shape, made from pasteurized milk, unless the fact that the cheese is made from pasteurized milk is indicated in the list of ingredients;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: a percentage declaration of milk fat in the case of partly-skimmed milk powder, buttermilk powder, dairy spread and calorie-reduced butter;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: a percentage declaration of skim milk powder and whey powder in the case of blended skim milk and whey powder and blended whey and skim milk powder;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: the words “Low Heat” or the abbreviation “Low Temp.” in the case of skim milk powder having a whey protein nitrogen content of not less than 6.0 mg/g, and the words “High Heat” or the abbreviation “High Temp.” in the case of skim milk powder having a whey protein nitrogen content of not more than 1.5 mg/g;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: the word “unsalted” in the case of unsalted butter and butter products other than cultured butter and butter products, and the word “salted” in the case of salted cultured butter and butter products, shown in close proximity to the common name;

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: the word “cultured” in the case of cultured butter and butter products, shown preceding the common name; and

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: the word “whipped” in the case of whipped butter and butter products, shown preceding the common name.

Subsection.Text: Every dairy product packed in bulk shall be labelled on any surface of the container, other than the bottom of the container, with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the list of ingredients and components thereof, as required by paragraph B.01.008(1)(b) of the Food and Drug Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the durable life date and instructions for proper storage of the dairy product, in those cases where the durable life is 90 days or less, as required by paragraph B.01.007(1.1)(b) of the Food and Drug Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the words “Product of” followed by the name of the country of origin in the case of imported dairy products;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the words “Product of Canada” in the case of dairy products packed for export; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of dry milk solids, the name and address of the person responsible for packing the product.

Subsection.Text: Where a dry milk product, butter, butter products or cheddar cheese is graded and labelled in accordance with these Regulations, the grade name shall be shown within the outline of a maple leaf in the same proportion as illustrated in Schedule IV.
Despite subsection (1), the stem of the maple leaf illustrated in Schedule IV may be reduced in proportion to half the illustrated length on a label.

Section.Text: A dairy product shall not be marked with any words or symbols descriptive of the quality of the product other than the grade name, unless the President of the Agency has determined that the connotation of quality conveyed by the words or symbols is valid.
Any information required by these Regulations to be shown on

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a prepackaged dairy product shall meet the requirements regarding the use of the official languages and the requirements regarding form and manner set out in the Consumer Packaging and Labelling Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a product packed in bulk, shall be shown in at least one official language.

Section.Text: No person shall market any dairy product for which standards are prescribed by these Regulations in import, export or interprovincial trade unless any advertising of the product meets the applicable requirements of this Part.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) to (4), no person shall export a dairy product unless the dairy product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: was prepared in a registered establishment in accordance with these Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meets the requirements of the standards established by these Regulations for the product.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a shipment of dairy products that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: weighs 20 kg or less;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is part of an emigrant’s effects; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is carried on any vessel, train, motor vehicle, aircraft or other means of transportation for use as food for the crew or passengers thereof.

Subsection.Text: A dairy product that does not meet the requirements of these Regulations may be exported where

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an inspector is provided with a signed statement from the shipper that the dairy product meets the requirements of the importing country; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the statement referred to in paragraph (a) is included in the export documentation.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraphs 23(a) and 73(a), a prepackaged dairy product may be exported if the labelling required by these Regulations is shown in at least one official language.

A dairy product that is not intended for human consumption may be exported without having been prepared in accordance with these Regulations if it is prominently labelled on the principal display panel with the words “Not for human consumption” and “Non destiné à la consommation humaine”.
Subject to subsection (2), no person shall convey from one province to another province a dairy product unless the dairy product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: was prepared in a registered establishment in accordance with these Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meets the requirements of the standards established by these Regulations for the product.

Subsection.Text: Dairy products may be conveyed from one province to another province without having been prepared in accordance with these Regulations, where the shipment of the dairy products

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: weighs 20 kg or less;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is not intended for sale in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has been permitted in writing by an inspector to be shipped;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: is not intended for human consumption and is prominently labelled on the principal display panel with the words “Not for human consumption” and “Non destiné à la consommation humaine”;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: is transported from one registered establishment to another registered establishment and is identified as being for further processing; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: is conveyed from one federal institution to another.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), no person shall import any dairy product unless the dairy product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: originated in a country that has

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: standards for dairy products that are at least equivalent to those set out in these Regulations, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a system of inspection for dairy products and for establishments that prepare dairy products that is at least equivalent to that in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meets the standards for a similar dairy product that is produced in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has been prepared under conditions at least equivalent to those required by these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: is labelled to show the words “Product of” and “Produit de” followed by the name of the country of origin;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: bears a label with the information required to be shown under the Consumer Packaging and Labelling Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: is accompanied by an import declaration, in a form provided by the Agency, duly completed in duplicate, dated and signed by the importer and containing the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the manufacturer,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the exporter,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the importer,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii.1)
Subparagraph.Text: if the dairy product is cheese, the importer’s cheese import licence number,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of each consignee,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the dairy product and any identification marks, including the product’s common name, grade and brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: for each consignee, the number of shipping containers and the number, size, net weight and kind of containers per shipping container, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement that the dairy product

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: was obtained from sound raw materials in accordance with good manufacturing practices,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: was prepared in a sanitary manner,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: in the case of a low-acid dairy product, was subjected to a thermal process that assures commercial sterility,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: originated in a country that has

Subclause.Label: (I)
Subclause.Text: standards for dairy products that are at least equivalent to those set out in these Regulations, and

Subclause.Label: (II)
Subclause.Text: a system for the inspection of dairy products and of establishments that prepare dairy products that is at least equivalent to that in Canada,

Clause.Label: (D.1)
Clause.Text: in the case of cheese, meets the standards set out in these Regulations,

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: was, at the time of shipment, sound and edible,

Clause.Label: (F)
Clause.Text: is accurately identified as to the name and address of the manufacturer or the manufacturer’s authorized agent,

Clause.Label: (G)
Clause.Text: is accurately described in the import declaration and does not contain any ingredients other than those permitted by these Regulations, and

Clause.Label: (H)
Clause.Text: meets the grade, container and labelling requirements of these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: A dairy product that does not meet the requirements of paragraphs (1)(a) and (c) may be imported if it meets the requirements of section 2.2 or 2.3 and the importer provides the Director with evidence to that effect. In such a case, that part of the statement required in the import declaration under clause (1)(f)(vii)(D) shall be omitted.
Paragraphs (1)(b) and (d) to (f) do not apply in respect of a shipment of dairy products that is not intended for sale in Canada and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: weighs 20 kg or less;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is carried on any vessel, train, motor vehicle, aircraft or other means of transportation for use as food for the crew or passengers thereof;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is part of an immigrant’s personal effects;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: is consigned to a national or international exhibition and weighs 100 kg or less; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: is imported from the United States into the Akwesasne Reserve for use by an Akwesasne resident.

Subsection.Text: Paragraph (3)(e) does not apply in respect of dairy products that are shipped to Canada from another country through the United States if the shipment is bonded.
For the purpose of paragraph (3)(e), Akwesasne resident means an individual who has established permanent residence on the Akwesasne Reserve.
No person shall import into Canada any cheese unless the person holds a cheese import licence issued under section 26.2.
Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a shipment of cheese to which subsection 26(3) applies.
The importer of a dairy product shall,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at the time of import, submit the import declaration to an inspector for verification; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: pay the applicable fee prescribed by the Canadian Food Inspection Agency Fees Notice, in accordance with the conditions of payment set out in that Notice.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a shipment of dairy products to which subsection 26(3) applies.
An application for the issuance, renewal or amendment of a cheese import licence shall be made to the Director, in a form provided by the Agency, and shall contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, the address, including the postal code, the telephone number and, if any, the e-mail address and the facsimile number of the importer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: whether it is an application for a new cheese import licence or for the renewal or amendment of a cheese import licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the number of the importer’s existing cheese import licence, if any.

Subsection.Text: The application shall have annexed to it

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the importer’s program for the recall of cheeses that do not meet the requirements set out in these Regulations, indicating

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person responsible for carrying out the program,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: descriptions of the coding system for the cheeses, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: notification and other procedures to effect the recall;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a list of cheeses expected to be imported during the period of the cheese import licence, and the country in which they originate; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the importer has an establishment in Canada for the purpose of the preparation of imported cheese, other than a registered establishment,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: plans and specifications for the establishment including descriptions of the location of the establishment in relation to adjacent facilities, intended uses of rooms, and types and locations of equipment to be used,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a copy of an outline of a sanitation program for the establishment, indicating

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the person responsible for carrying out the program,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the equipment and chemical agents available for use to bring about and maintain clean and sanitary conditions, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: the measures proposed to be taken to ensure clean and sanitary conditions,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a copy of the pest control program for the establishment, indicating

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the person responsible for carrying out the program, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the measures proposed to be taken to safely and effectively control insects, birds, rodents and other vermin, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a document indicating the source of water to be used at the establishment for drinking or for cheese preparation and a copy of a certificate of microbiological analysis of the water.

Subsection.Text: In the case of an application for the renewal or amendment of a cheese import licence, the applicant is not required to provide the information referred to in subsection (2), other than the information referred to subparagraph (2)(c)(iv), unless there has been a change in the information.

If the application meets the requirements of subsections (1) and (2), the Director shall issue a cheese import licence and assign a number to it or shall amend or renew a cheese import licence, as the case may be.
The cheese import licence is not assignable and expires two years after the date of issue indicated on it.

Section.Text: Every importer who holds a cheese import licence shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: maintain the recall program referred to in paragraph 26.2(2)(a);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: maintain and carry out the programs referred to in subparagraphs26.2(2)(c)(ii) and (iii), if the importer has an establishment in Canada for the purpose of the preparation of imported cheese, other than a registered establishment;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: provide to an inspector the certificate of microbiological analysis referred to in subparagraph 26.2(2)(c)(iv) once a year, if the importer has an establishment in Canada for the purpose of the preparation of imported cheese, other than a registered establishment; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: make available to an inspector evidence that substantiates that each imported cheese meets the requirements set out in these Regulations.

Section.Text: An importer who holds a cheese import licence shall keep for two years at an address in Canada, in respect of each imported cheese,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the import declaration referred to in paragraph 26(1)(f);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of any evidence in the possession of the importer that substantiates that the cheese meets the requirements set out in these Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the product code for the cheese,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the names, addresses and telephone numbers of the persons to whom the cheese was distributed,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: any complaints received about the cheese and how the complaints were handled, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: any recall carried out with respect to the cheese.

Subsection.Text: The Director may suspend a cheese import licence if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the importer has

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: provided false or misleading information to the Director for the purpose of obtaining the cheese import licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: failed to submit an import declaration as required by paragraph 26.1(1)(a),

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: provided false information to an inspector in an import declaration required to be submitted by paragraph 26.1(1)(a),

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: failed to make evidence available as required by paragraph 26.3(d),

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: failed to keep a record in accordance with paragraph 26.4(c), or

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: otherwise failed to meet the requirements of the Act or these Regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is reasonable to believe that public health will be endangered if the importer is allowed to continue importing.

Subsection.Text: A cheese import licence shall not be suspended under paragraph (1)(a) unless an inspector notifies the importer in writing of the reasons for the suspension and of the date by which the importer must meet the requirements of the Act and these Regulations in order to avoid the suspension or to avoid the cancellation of the licence under section 26.6.
A suspension of a cheese import licence shall remain in effect

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: until an inspector verifies that the importer meets the requirements of the Act and these Regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if a cancellation procedure has been commenced under section 26.6, until the resolution of the cancellation issue.

Subsection.Text: The Director may cancel a cheese import licence if the importer continues to fail to meet the requirements of the Act and these Regulations after

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the 30-day period following the day on which the cheese import licence was suspended; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any longer period allowed under subsection (2).

Subsection.Text: If it is not possible for the importer to meet the requirements of the Act and these Regulations within that 30 day period, the Director may, on the request of the importer, allow a longer period to do so.

A cheese import licence shall not be cancelled unless an inspector notifies the importer in writing of the reasons for the cancellation and the importer is provided an opportunity to be heard in respect of the cancellation.

Section.Text: A dairy product for which a standard is established under these Regulations shall be free from salmonella and other pathogenic organisms of human health significance, as determined by acceptable methods.

Subsection.Text: (Naming the variety) Cheese, other than cheddar cheese, cream cheese, whey cheese, cream cheese with (named added ingredients), cream cheese spread, cream cheese spread with (named added ingredients), processed (named variety) cheese, processed (named variety) cheese with (named added ingredients), processed cheese food, processed cheese food with (named added ingredients), processed cheese spread, processed cheese spread with (named added ingredients), cold-pack (named variety) cheese, cold-pack (named variety) cheese with (named added ingredients), cold-pack cheese food, cold-pack cheese food with (named added ingredients), cottage cheese and creamed cottage cheese,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be the product made by coagulating milk, milk products or a combination thereof with the aid of bacteria to form a curd and forming the curd into a homogeneous mass after draining the whey,

Subparagraph.Label: (i.1)
Subparagraph.Text: except for feta cheese, have a casein content that is derived from milk or from ultrafiltered milk, partly skimmed milk, ultrafiltered partly skimmed milk, skim milk, ultrafiltered skim milk or cream, rather than from other milk products, that is at least the following percentage of the total protein content of the cheese, namely,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: 63 per cent, in the case of Pizza Mozzarella cheese and Part Skim Pizza Mozzarella cheese,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: 83 per cent, in the case of Brick cheese, Canadian Style Brick cheese, Canadian Style Munster cheese, Colby cheese, Farmer’s cheese, Jack cheese, Monterey (Monterey Jack) cheese, Mozzarella (Scamorza) cheese, Part Skim Mozzarella (Part Skim Scamorza) cheese, Part Skim Pizza cheese, Pizza cheese, Skim Milk cheese and any other variety of cheese not referred to in clause (A) or (C), and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: 95 per cent, in the case of any other variety of cheese named in the table to this section,

Subparagraph.Label: (i.2)
Subparagraph.Text: have a whey protein to casein ratio that does not exceed the whey protein to casein ratio of milk,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: possess the physical, chemical and organoleptic properties typical for the variety,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: where it is a cheese of a variety named in the table to this section, contain no more than the maximum percentage of moisture shown in Column II thereof for that variety,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: where it is a cheese of a variety named in Part I of the table to this section, contain no less than the minimum percentage of milk fat shown in Column III for that variety, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: where it is a cheese of a variety named in Part II of the table to this section, contain no more than the maximum percentage of milk fat shown in Column III for that variety; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: salt, seasonings, condiments and spices,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: permitted flavouring preparations,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: micro-organisms to aid further ripening, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: permitted food additives.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding subparagraphs (1)(a)(iii) and (iv), a cheese of a variety set out in column I of an item of Part I of the table to this section may contain more than the maximum percentage of moisture set out in column II of that item and less than the minimum percentage of milk fat set out in column III of that item, where

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement or claim set out in column 4 of any of items 12 to 14, 16, 20, 21 and 45 of the table following section B.01.513 of the Food and Drug Regulations is shown on the label of the product as part of the common name; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the cheese has the characteristic flavour and texture of the named variety of cheese.

Subsection.Text: The reference to “83 per cent” in clause (1)(a)(i.1)(B) shall be read as “78 per cent”, and the reference to “95 per cent” in clause (1)(a)(i.1)(C) shall be read as “90 per cent”, with respect to the named variety of cheese if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement or claim set out in column 4 of any of items 12 to 14, 16, 20, 21 and 45 of the table following section B.01.513 of the Food and Drug Regulations is shown on the label of the product as part of the common name; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the cheese has the characteristic flavour and texture of the named variety of cheese.

Section.Text: Any cheese product for which a standard is established by any of sections 29 to 45 may contain more than the maximum percentage of moisture set out in the applicable standard and less than the minimum percentage of milk fat set out in the applicable standard, where

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the characteristic flavour and texture of the cheese product are maintained in the modified cheese product; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the product name includes descriptive terminology that meets the requirements of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the Food and Drugs Act and the Food and Drug Regulations with respect to claims and statements, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Guide to Food Labelling and Advertising, as amended from time to time, published by the Agency, with respect to the use of the terms “light” and “lite”.

Section.Text: Cottage cheese shall be the product, in the form of discrete curd particles, prepared from skim milk, evaporated skim milk or skim milk powder and harmless acid-producing bacterial cultures, may contain milk, cream, milk powder, rennet, salt, calcium chloride, added lactose, pH adjusting agents, relish fruits or vegetables and shall contain not more than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 80 per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 0.5 per cent stabilizing agent.

Section.Text: Creamed cottage cheese shall be cottage cheese that contains a mixture of cream, cream with milk, skim milk or both in such quantity that the final product shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not less than four per cent milk fat, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not more than 80 per cent moisture,
