ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: and may contain emulsifying, gelling, stabilizing and thickening agents.

Section.Text: Whey Cheese or (naming the variety) Whey Cheese

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product made by coagulating whey or concentrated whey with the aid of heat to form a curd and shaping the curd; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: micro-organisms to aid further ripening,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: added milk and milk products, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: permitted food additives.

Section.Text: Cream Cheese

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be the product made by coagulating cream with the aid of bacteria to form a curd and forming the curd into a homogeneous mass after draining the whey, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: not more than 55 per cent moisture, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: not less than 30 per cent milk fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: cream added to adjust the milk fat content,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: permitted food additives.

Section.Text: Cream Cheese with (naming the added ingredients)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be the product made by coagulating cream with the aid of bacteria to form a curd and forming the curd into a homogeneous mass after draining the whey, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain the named added ingredients which shall be one or more of the following ingredients in amounts sufficient to differentiate the product from cream cheese but not in amounts so large as to change the basic nature of the product:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: cheese other than cream cheese,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: seasonings, spices, flavouring preparations, condiments or chocolate,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: fruits, vegetables, pickles, relishes or nuts,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: prepared or preserved meat, or

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: prepared or preserved fish, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: not more than 60 per cent moisture, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: not less than 26 per cent milk fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: cream added to adjust the milk fat content,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: permitted food additives.

Section.Text: Cream Cheese Spread

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be the product made by coagulating cream with the aid of bacteria to form a curd and forming the curd into a homogeneous mass after draining the whey, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: added milk and milk products,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: not less than 51 per cent cream cheese,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: not more than 60 per cent moisture, and

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: not less than 24 per cent milk fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: cream added to adjust the milk fat content,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt, vinegar and sweetening agents, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: permitted food additives.

Section.Text: Cream Cheese Spread with (naming the added ingredients)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be the product made by coagulating cream with the aid of bacteria to form a curd and forming the curd into a homogeneous mass after draining the whey,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain the named added ingredients which shall be one or more of the following ingredients in amounts sufficient to differentiate the product from cream cheese spread but not in amounts so large as to change the basic nature of the product:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: cheese other than cream cheese,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: seasonings, spices, flavouring preparation, condiments or chocolate,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: fruits, vegetables, pickles, relishes or nuts,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: prepared or preserved meat, or

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: prepared or preserved fish, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: added milk and milk products,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: not more than 60 per cent moisture, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: not less than 24 per cent milk fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: cream added to adjust the milk fat content,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt, vinegar and sweetening agents, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: permitted food additives.

Section.Text: Processed (naming the variety) Cheese

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (ii), be the product made by comminuting and mixing the named variety or varieties of cheese, other than cream cheese, cottage cheese or whey cheese, into a homogeneous mass with the aid of heat,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of processed cheddar cheese, be the product made by comminuting and mixing one or more of the following:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: cheddar cheese,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: stirred curd cheese,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: granular curd cheese, or

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: washed curd cheese

ContinuedSubparagraph.Text: into a homogeneous mass with the aid of heat,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: have, where it is made from

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: one variety of cheese, in which the maximum amount of moisture permitted is less than 40 per cent, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: more than one variety of cheese, in which the average maximum amount of moisture permitted is less than 40 per cent,

ContinuedSubparagraph.Text: a moisture content that does not exceed, by more than five per cent, the amount referred to in clause (A) or (B), as the case may be, and a milk fat content that is not less, by more than three per cent, than the minimum milk fat content or average minimum milk fat content permitted for that variety or those varieties, as the case may be,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (v), have, where it is made from

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: one variety of cheese, in which the maximum amount of moisture permitted is 40 per cent or more, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: two or more varieties of cheese, in which the average maximum amount of moisture permitted is 40 per cent or more,

ContinuedSubparagraph.Text: a moisture content that does not exceed, by more than three per cent, the amount referred to in clause (A) or (B), as the case may be, and a milk fat content that is not less, by more than two per cent, than the minimum milk fat content or average minimum milk fat content permitted for that variety or those varieties, as the case may be, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of processed skim milk cheese, contain not more than

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: 55 per cent moisture, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: seven per cent milk fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: water added to adjust the moisture content,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: added milk fat,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of processed skim milk cheese, added skim milk powder, buttermilk powder and whey powder,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: salt, vinegar and sweetening agents, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: permitted food additives.

Section.Text: Processed (naming the variety) Cheese with (naming the added ingredients)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain the named added ingredients which shall be one or more of the following ingredients in amounts sufficient to differentiate the product from processed (named variety) cheese but not in amounts so large as to change the basic nature of the product:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: flavouring preparations other than such preparations that resemble the flavour of the varieties of cheese used in the product,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: seasonings, spices, condiments or chocolate,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: fruits, vegetables, pickles, relishes or nuts,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: prepared or preserved meat, or

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: prepared or preserved fish,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: have, where it is made from

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: one variety of cheese, in which the maximum amount of moisture permitted is less than 40 per cent, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: more than one variety of cheese, in which the average maximum amount of moisture permitted is less than 40 per cent,

ContinuedSubparagraph.Text: a moisture content that does not exceed by more than five per cent, the amount referred to in clause (A) or (B), as the case may be, and a milk fat content that is not less, by more than three per cent, than the minimum milk fat content or average minimum milk fat content permitted for that variety or those varieties, as the case may be, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: have, where it is made from

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: one variety of cheese, in which the maximum amount of moisture permitted is 40 per cent or more, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: more than one variety of cheese, in which the average maximum amount of moisture permitted is 40 per cent or more,

ContinuedSubparagraph.Text: a moisture content that does not exceed, by more than three per cent, the amount referred to in clause (A) or (B), as the case may be, and a milk fat content that is not less, by more than two per cent, than the minimum milk fat content or average minimum milk fat content permitted for that variety or those varieties, as the case may be; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: water added to adjust moisture content,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: added milk fat,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt, vinegar and sweetening agents, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: permitted food additives.

Section.Text: Processed Cheese Food

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be the product made by comminuting and mixing one or more varieties of cheese, other than cream cheese, cottage cheese or whey cheese, into a homogeneous mass with the aid of heat, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: added milk or milk products,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: not less than 51 per cent cheese,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: not more than 46 per cent moisture, and

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: not less than 23 per cent milk fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: water added to adjust the moisture content,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: added milk fat,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt, vinegar and sweetening agents, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)

Clause.Label: (A)

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt, vinegar and sweetening agents, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: permitted food additives.

Section.Text: Cold-Pack (naming the variety) Cheese

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (ii), be the product made by comminuting and mixing the named variety or varieties of cheese, other than cream cheese, cottage cheese or whey cheese, into a homogeneous mass without the aid of heat,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of cold-pack cheddar cheese, be the product made by comminuting and mixing one or more of the following:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: cheddar cheese,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: stirred curd cheese,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: granular curd cheese, or

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: washed curd cheese

ContinuedSubparagraph.Text: into a homogeneous mass without the aid of heat,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain, where it is made from

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: one variety of cheese, not more moisture and not less milk fat than the maximum moisture content and minimum fat content permitted for that variety, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: more than one variety of cheese, not more moisture and not less milk fat than the average maximum moisture content and the average minimum fat content permitted for those varieties; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: water added to adjust the moisture content,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: added milk fat,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt, vinegar and sweetening agents, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: permitted food additives.

Section.Text: Cold-Pack (naming the variety) Cheese with (naming the added ingredients)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be the product made by comminuting and mixing the named variety or varieties of cheese, other than cream cheese, cottage cheese or whey cheese, into a homogeneous mass without the aid of heat,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain the named added ingredients which shall be one or more of the following ingredients in amounts sufficient to differentiate the product from cold-pack (named variety) cheese but not in amounts so large as to change the basic nature of the product:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: flavouring preparations other than such preparations that resemble the flavour of the varieties of cheese used in the product,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: seasonings, spices, condiments or chocolate,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: fruits, vegetables, pickles, relishes or nuts,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: prepared or preserved meat, or

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: prepared or preserved fish, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain, where it is made from

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: one variety of cheese, not more moisture and not less milk fat than the maximum moisture content and one per cent less than the minimum milk fat content permitted for that variety, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: more than one variety of cheese, not more moisture and not less milk fat than the average maximum moisture content and one per cent less than the average minimum milk fat content permitted for those varieties; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: water added to adjust the moisture content,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: added milk fat,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt, vinegar and sweetening agents, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: permitted food additives.

Section.Text: Cold-Pack Cheese Food

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be the product made by comminuting and mixing one or more varieties of cheese, other than cream cheese, cottage cheese or whey cheese, into a homogeneous mass without the aid of heat,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: added milk or milk products,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: not less than 51 per cent cheese,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: not more than 46 per cent moisture, and

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: not less than 23 per cent milk fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: water added to adjust the moisture content,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: added milk fat,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt, vinegar and sweetening agents, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: permitted food additives.

Section.Text: Cold-Pack Cheese Food with (naming the added ingredients)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be the product made by comminuting and mixing one or more varieties of cheese, other than cream cheese, cottage cheese or whey cheese, into a homogeneous mass without the aid of heat,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain the named added ingredients which shall be one or more of the following ingredients in amounts sufficient to differentiate the product from cold-pack cheese food but not in amounts so large as to change the basic nature of the product:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: seasonings, spices, flavouring preparations, condiments or chocolate,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: fruits, vegetables, pickles, relishes or nuts,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: prepared or preserved meat, or

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: prepared or preserved fish, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: added milk or milk products,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: not more than 46 per cent moisture, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: not less than 22 per cent milk fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: water added to adjust moisture content,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: added milk fat,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt, vinegar and sweetening agents, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: permitted food additives.

Section.Text: Butter with flavour or seasoning shall be butter to which a flavour, other than that of butter, or a seasoning has been added, and shall contain not less than 80 per cent milk fat.

Butter with (naming the fruit, vegetable, or relish) shall be butter to which fruit, vegetable or relish has been added, and may contain less than 80 per cent milk fat, if the percentage of milk fat is reduced by the amount of the product added, but in no case shall the resultant milk fat content be less than 75 per cent.

Butter Oil (Clarified Butter) shall be the product prepared from butter or cream and resulting from the removal of most of the water and solids-not-fat content, and shall contain not less than 99.3 per cent milk fat and not more than 0.5 per cent water.

Anhydrous Butter Oil shall be the product obtained from butter or cream and resulting from the removal of practically the entire water and solids-not-fat content, and shall contain not less than 99.8 per cent milk fat, and not more than 0.1 per cent water.

Subsection.Text: Mix for Frozen Dairy Products

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the unfrozen, pasteurized food composed of milk, cream or other milk products, singularly or in combination, and sweetened with permitted sweetening agents; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: egg,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a flavouring preparation,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: cocoa or chocolate syrup,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: permitted food additives,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: up to one per cent added edible casein or edible caseinates, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of frozen dairy dessert mix, fruit juice.

Subsection.Text: A mix for frozen dairy products the common name of which is set out in Column I of an item of the table to this section shall contain percentages of solids and milk fat that fall within the minimum and maximum percentages set out in Column II or III of that item, depending on whether the mix contains cocoa or chocolate syrup.

Where a mix for frozen dairy products contains percentages of solids and milk fat that fall within the minimum and maximum percentages set out in Column II or III of an item of the table to this section, the common name set out in Column I of that item shall be used in any advertisement of the mix.

row.entry: Mix without Cocoa or Chocolate Syrup
Mix with Cocoa or Chocolate Syrup

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, frozen dairy product means ice cream, light ice cream, ice milk and frozen dairy dessert.
Frozen Dairy Product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the frozen food obtained by the freezing of a mix for a frozen dairy product, with or without the incorporation of air, and may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: cocoa or chocolate syrup,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: fruit, nuts and confections, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a product labelled or marketed as frozen dairy dessert, fruit juice; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 100,000 bacteria per gram, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 10 coliform organisms per gram.

Subsection.Text: A frozen dairy product the common name of which is set out in Column I of an item of the table to this section shall contain percentages and quantities of solids and percentages of milk fat that fall within the minimum and maximum percentages and quantities set out in Column II or III of that item, depending on whether the frozen dairy product contains cocoa, chocolate syrup, fruit, nuts or confections.

Where a frozen dairy product contains percentages and quantities of solids and percentages of milk fat that fall within the minimum and maximum percentages and quantities set out in Column II or III of an item of the table to this section, the common name set out in Column I of that item shall be used in any advertisement of the frozen dairy product.
In the table to this section, > means greater than.

row.entry: Without Cocoa, Chocolate Syrup, Fruit, Nuts or Confections
With Cocoa, Chocolate Syrup, Fruit, Nuts or Confections

Section.Text: Sherbet

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the frozen food, other than ice cream, light ice cream, ice milk or frozen dairy dessert, made from a milk product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: water,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: permitted sweetening agents,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: fruits or fruit juice,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a flavouring preparation,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: permitted food additives, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: up to one per cent added edible casein or edible caseinates; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than five per cent milk solids, including milk fat, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 0.35 per cent acid determined by titration and expressed as lactic acid.

Section.Text: Milk Shake Mix

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the unfrozen, pasteurized combination of milk, cream or other milk products, sweetened with permitted sweetening agents;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: egg,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: flavouring preparation,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: cocoa or chocolate syrup,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: permitted food additives, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: up to one per cent added edible casein or edible caseinates; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 23 per cent total solids, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than three per cent milk fat.

Section.Text: Evaporated Milk or Concentrated Milk

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be milk from which water has been removed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 25.0 per cent milk solids,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 7.5 per cent milk fat, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: added vitamins as required pursuant to section B.08.010 of the Food and Drug Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain permitted food additives.

Section.Text: Condensed Milk or Sweetened Concentrated Milk is milk from which water has been removed and to which has been added permitted sweetening agents, and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: may contain added vitamin D in accordance with section B.08.009 of the Food and Drug Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 28 per cent milk solids, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 8 per cent milk fat.

Section.Text: Evaporated Skim Milk or Concentrated Skim Milk

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be milk that has been reduced to one half of its original volume by the removal of water;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 0.3 per cent milk fat,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 17.0 per cent milk solids other than fat, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: added vitamins as required pursuant to section B.08.011 of the Food and Drug Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain permitted food additives.

Section.Text: Evaporated Partly Skimmed Milk or Concentrated Partly Skimmed Milk

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be milk from which part of the milk fat has been removed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall be milk that has been reduced to one half of its original volume by the removal of water;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than 17.0 per cent milk solids other than fat;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain vitamins as required pursuant to section B.08.012 of the Food and Drug Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: may contain permitted food additives.

Section.Text: Malted Milk Powder

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product made by combining milk with the liquid separated from a mash of ground barley malt and meal and, on the removal of water,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 7.5 per cent milk fat, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 3.5 per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain permitted food additives.

Section.Text: (naming the flavour) Malted Milk Powder, shall be malted milk powder containing a flavouring preparation.
Sterilized Milk

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be milk that has been heated without concentration or appreciable loss of volume to a temperature of at least 100°C for a length of time sufficient to kill all the organisms present;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall be packed in hermetically sealed containers;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 11.75 per cent milk solids, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 3.25 per cent milk fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain vitamins as required pursuant to section B.08.007 of the Food and Drug Regulations.

Section.Text: Sterilized Cream

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be cream that has been heated without significant concentration to a temperature of at least 100°C for a length of time sufficient to kill all the organisms present;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall be packed in hermetically sealed containers; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain permitted food additives.

Section.Text: Every dairy product for which a standard is prescribed under this Part shall be packed in accordance with the requirements of subsections 16(2) to (4).

Heading.TitleText: Thermal Processing of Low-Acid Dairy Products Packaged in Hermetically Sealed Containers

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), every operator shall ensure that every low-acid dairy product packaged in a hermetically sealed container in a registered establishment is thermally processed until commercial sterility is achieved.
Subsection (1) does not apply to a low-acid dairy product packaged in a hermetically sealed container where

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the low-acid dairy product is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: stored continuously under refrigeration at a temperature of 4°C or less and the container in which it is packaged is marked “Keep Refrigerated” and “Garder au froid”, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: kept continuously frozen and the container in which it is packaged is marked “Keep Frozen” and “Garder congelé”; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the shipping containers of the low-acid dairy product are also marked accordingly.

Section.Text: The operator of a registered establishment in which a low-acid dairy product packaged in a hermetically sealed container is thermally processed shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: keep in the establishment, for every low-acid dairy product that is processed,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a written description of the scheduled process, together with the name of the person responsible for the development of the scheduled process, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the formulation of the dairy product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: keep the information referred to in subparagraphs (a)(i) and (ii) for at least three years after the most recent use of the scheduled process;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: keep in the establishment, for every low-acid dairy product that is processed, a written description of the procedures for the operation and maintenance of each unit of thermal processing equipment;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: keep in the establishment a written description of a low-acid dairy product recall procedure;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: retain, for not less than three years after the date of processing, records that adequately set out the low-acid dairy product’s history and include as minimum information

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: production volume, identification and distribution records,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the unit of thermal processing equipment used, the time, temperature and, where appropriate, the pressure of the process used,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the systems used to control the thermal process and critical factors,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: information concerning the maintenance of and modifications to each unit of thermal processing equipment and each monitoring device,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: process deviations and any corrective action taken,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: incubation results, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: where applicable, cooling water treatments applied; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: notify an inspector when a low-acid dairy product is to be recalled.

Section.Text: Every operator of a registered establishment shall ensure that no low-acid dairy product packaged in a hermetically sealed container is thermally processed in the registered establishment unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the container, prior to being filled, meets the manufacturer’s specifications and is in all other respects suitable for its intended use;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the filling of the container is controlled to ensure compliance with the scheduled process;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the operation of each closing head is evaluated at frequent intervals and adjusted as required to maintain closures within the designated operating limits of the closing head;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the container is labelled in a legible and permanent manner to identify the establishment, the dairy product and the date on which the dairy product is thermally processed;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the thermal processing is carried out under the continuous supervision of a person who has attended a course in thermal processing and has received a certificate of competence on completion of the course;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the thermal process used meets or exceeds the requirements of the scheduled process;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a written description of the thermal process to be used for each low-acid dairy product and container size is located in a conspicuous place near the unit of thermal processing equipment while the unit is in use;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: each unit of thermal processing equipment is maintained in good working order;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: each unit of thermal processing equipment is equipped with adequate monitoring devices that are maintained in good working order;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: where batch thermal processing is employed, a heat-sensitive indicator that visually indicates whether or not the container has been thermally processed is placed on or attached directly or indirectly to the container;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the container cooling water is of an acceptable microbiological quality and, in the case of water used in a cooling canal system, contains a residual amount of a bactericide at the discharge end of the canal; and

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: the container is handled in a manner that ensures that the container remains hermetically sealed.

Section.Text: Any information that is required to be shown on the label of a prepackaged dairy product for which standards are prescribed pursuant to this Part shall be shown in the manner and size set out in subsections 18(1) and (3).

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (4), every prepackaged dairy product for which standards are prescribed by these Regulations shall bear a label on the principal display surface of the container, showing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the common name of the dairy product;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: a declaration of the net quantity, as required by the Consumer Packaging and Labelling Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a percentage declaration of moisture and milk fat in the case of all cheese, whey cheese and cheese curd;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a percentage declaration of milk fat in the case of cottage cheese, creamed cottage cheese, sterilized cream and evaporated partly-skimmed milk or concentrated partly-skimmed milk;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a statement as to the source of the milk, where the dairy product consists of or was manufactured wholly or partly from milk that is the normal secretion of the mammary gland of animals other than the cow and the source is not indicated in the common name; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the words “Product of” followed by the name of the country of origin, in the case of cheese prepackaged in Canada from imported bulk.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (4), every prepackaged dairy product for which standards are prescribed by these Regulations shall bear a label on any panel of the container, other than the bottom of the container, showing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the list of ingredients and components thereof, as required by paragraph B.01.008(1)(b) of the Food and Drug Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the durable life date and instructions for proper storage of the dairy product, in those cases where the durable life is 90 days or less, as required by paragraph B.01.007(1.1)(b) of the Food and Drug Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the words “Product of” followed by the name of the country of origin in the case of an imported dairy product; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the words “Product of Canada” when packed for export from Canada.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (4), every prepackaged dairy product for which standards are prescribed by these Regulations shall bear a label on any panel of the container, showing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a domestic dairy product, where the name and address shown on the label are not that of the actual establishment in which the prepackaged dairy product was prepared,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the registration number of the establishment in which the dairy product was prepared, shown within an eight-sided frame in the same proportions as illustrated in Schedule V, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the registration number of the establishment in which the dairy product was prepared, preceded by the words “Registration Number” or the abbreviation “Reg. No.” or “Reg.”; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a batch number, code number or lot number identifying an appropriate, meaningful sized unit of production.

Subsection.Text: The labelling requirements of this section do not apply in respect of prepackaged individual portions of dairy products that are for sale from automatic vending machines or mobile canteens, or that are served by a restaurant or other commercial enterprise with meals or as snacks.
Notwithstanding paragraph (3)(a), the registration number of a registered establishment may be shown on the shipping container where

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the combined weight of the product and the container is less than 75 g when packed in metric units or less than 3 oz when packed in Canadian units; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the volume of the product is less than 100 ml when packed in metric units or less than 5 fl oz when packed in Canadian units.

Section.Text: The word “smoked” may only appear on the principal display panel of a prepackaged cheese or prepackaged cheese product when wood smoke is used.

Subsection.Text: Prepackaged varietal cheese, except cottage cheese and cheese listed in the table to section 28, shall show on the principal display panel

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the relative firmness of the cheese, identified in accordance with subsection (2);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: except in the case of a soft white cheese, a reference to the principal ripening characteristic of the cheese, identified in accordance with subsection (4);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of hard cheese intended for grating and having a moisture content of 34 per cent or less, the words “Hard Grating Cheese”; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of mixtures of grated or shredded cheese, the varieties of cheese used, in order of their proportion in the product.

Subsection.Text: The relative firmness of prepackaged cheese shall be identified by one of the following expressions:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “soft white cheese”, in the case of cheese having a moisture on fat-free basis content of 80 per cent or more;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “soft cheese”, in the case of cheese having a moisture on fat-free basis content of more than 67 per cent and less than 80 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “semi-soft cheese”, in the case of cheese having a moisture on fat-free basis content of more than 62 per cent and not more than 67 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: “firm cheese”, in the case of cheese having a moisture on fat-free basis content of 50 per cent or more and not more than 62 per cent; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: “hard cheese”, in the case of cheese having a moisture on fat-free basis content of less than 50 per cent.

Subsection.Text: The relative firmness of prepackaged cheese shall be verified by a grader or inspector by means of a chemical test and a physical examination, and the findings of the grader or inspector shall be conclusive for the purposes of this Part.
The principal ripening characteristic of prepackaged cheese shall be identified by one of the following terms or expressions:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “ripened”, where the ripening process develops within the whole body of the cheese;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “surface ripened”, where the ripening process starts from the surface and moves into the body of the cheese;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “blue veined”, where veins of mould occur within the body of the cheese; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: “unripened” or “fresh”, where the cheese has not undergone any ripening.

Subsection.Text: Where a cheese to which subsection (1) applies has a name marked thereon, the name shall in no case be more than twice the height of lettering for the information required pursuant to paragraphs (1)(a), (b) and (c).

Any information that is required to be shown on the label of a dairy product packed in bulk for which standards are prescribed pursuant to this Part shall be shown in the manner and size set out in subsections 18(1), (2) and (4), except that the information required by paragraph (3)(b) need only be shown in letters of a height that is sufficient so as to be legible.
Subject to subsection (4), every dairy product packed in bulk for which standards are prescribed by these Regulations shall bear a label on the principal display surface of the container, showing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the common name of the product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the registration number within an eight-sided frame in the same proportion as illustrated in Schedule V, in the case of a domestic dairy product;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the words “churn number” or “numéro de barattée” or the abbreviation “ch. no.” or “no de bar.” for butter and similar products, followed by the churn number, the churn number to begin with the number 1 on January 1st of each calendar year and to run consecutively throughout the calendar year;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of cheese, the vat number to begin with the number 1 on January 1st of each calendar year and to run consecutively throughout the calendar year;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a declaration of net contents in Canadian units, metric units or both grouped together;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a series of numbers indicating the day, month and year in which the dairy product was prepared and in the case of a dry milk product for which daily production is divided into two or three lots, the letter A, B or C to indicate the lot in which the product was prepared; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the word “Pasteurized” or “Pasteurisé” in the case of cheese still in its original shape, made from pasteurized milk, unless the fact that the cheese is made from pasteurized milk is indicated in the list of ingredients.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (4), every dairy product packed in bulk for which standards are prescribed by these Regulations shall bear a label on any panel of the container, other than the bottom of the container, showing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the identity and principal place of business of the person by or for whom the dairy product was manufactured or produced for resale;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the list of ingredients and components thereof, as required by paragraph B.01.008(1)(b) of the Food and Drug Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the durable life date and instructions for proper storage of the dairy product, in those cases where the durable life is 90 days or less, as required by paragraph B.01.007(1.1)(b) of the Food and Drug Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the words “Product of” or “Produit de” followed by the name of the country of origin in the case of an imported dairy product; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the words “Product of Canada” or “Produit du Canada” when packed for export from Canada.

Subsection.Text: Cheese packed in bulk shall be marked in accordance with section 21.

Section.Text: A dairy product for which standards are prescribed pursuant to this Part shall not be described or presented on any label in a manner that is false, misleading or deceptive or is likely to create an erroneous impression regarding the product’s value, quantity, composition, quality, identity or nature.
Any information required by this Part to be shown on

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a prepackaged dairy product shall meet the requirements regarding the use of the official languages and the requirements regarding form and manner set out in the Consumer Packaging and Labelling Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a product packed in bulk, shall be shown in at least one official language.

Subsection.Text: A person who wishes to have dairy products analysed, inspected or graded shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: make a request to an inspector or, if there is no inspector in the area, at the nearest inspection office, at least 14 days before the service is required;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: present the dairy products at a place and time designated by an inspector;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: make all dairy products from which samples will be drawn by the inspector readily accessible and ensure that they are in a condition suitable for analysis, inspection or grading;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: be available to assist the inspector, or designate an employee on the premises who will be available to assist the inspector, to open and close the containers and provide such other assistance as the inspector may request in order to provide the service;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: indicate the grade names, if any, proposed to be placed on the containers, where the dairy products are unlabelled at the time they are presented; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: pay the applicable fee prescribed by the Canadian Food Inspection Agency Fees Notice, in accordance with the conditions of payment set out in that Notice.

Section.Text: Where, because of poor examination conditions or latent defects in a dairy product, an inspector or grader is unable to determine the grade of the dairy product, the inspector or grader may postpone the inspection of the dairy product for such period as the inspector or grader considers necessary to enable the determination of the grade to be made.

Subsection.Text: Where an inspector seizes and detains a dairy product or any other thing pursuant to section 23 of the Act, the inspector shall affix to the dairy product or any other thing a detention tag on which the following is clearly marked:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the words “UNDER DETENTION” and “RETENU” in boldface letters;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an identification number;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the dairy product or other thing;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the reason for the seizure and detention;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the seizure and detention; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the inspector, in block letters, and the signature of the inspector.

Subsection.Text: No person shall alter, deface or remove a detention tag attached to a dairy product or any other thing unless the person is authorized to do so by an inspector.
An inspector shall, after detaining a dairy product or any other thing in accordance with subsection 77(1), forthwith deliver or mail a notice of detention

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to the person having the care or custody of the dairy product or other thing at the place where it was seized and to the person having the care or custody of the dairy product or other thing at the place where it is being detained;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to the owner of the dairy product or other thing that was seized, or to the owner’s agent; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: where the dairy product or other thing is removed from the place where it was seized to another place in accordance with subsection 19(5) or 25(1) of the Act, to the person having the care or custody of the dairy product or other thing at that other place.

Subsection.Text: A notice of detention referred to in subsection (1) shall state that the dairy product or other thing was seized and detained pursuant to section 23 of the Act and shall set out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the detention tag identification number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the dairy product or other thing;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the reason for the seizure and detention;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the seizure and detention;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the inspector, in block letters, and the signature of the inspector;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the place of detention; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the telephone number to call for further information in respect of the seizure and detention.

Section.Text: A dairy product or other thing detained under section 23 of the Act shall be detained under storage conditions appropriate to the preservation of the dairy product or other thing.

If an inspector releases a dairy product or other thing after determining that it meets the requirements of the Act and these Regulations, the inspector shall deliver or mail one copy of a notice of release to each of the persons to whom a copy of a notice of detention referred to in subsection 78(1) was delivered or mailed.

Subsection.Text: Any dairy product or other thing forfeited under subsection 28(1) of the Act shall be disposed of in the manner ordered by the court directing the forfeiture and, if no order for the disposition of the dairy product or other thing is made by that court, the dairy product or other thing shall be disposed of in the following manner:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a dairy product that is edible, it shall be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: sold and the proceeds deposited to the credit of the Receiver General, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: donated to a charitable institution;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a dairy product that is inedible, it shall be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: sold for preparation as animal food or as a non-food product, and the proceeds deposited to the credit of the Receiver General, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: disposed of or destroyed; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a thing other than a dairy product, it shall be sold and the proceeds deposited to the credit of the Receiver General.

Subsection.Text: Any dairy product or other thing forfeited under subsection 28(2) of the Act shall be disposed of in the manner set out in subsection (1).

Section.Text: Dairy products that are forfeited under subsection 30(2) of the Act shall be disposed of in the following manner:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a dairy product that is edible, it shall be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: sold and the proceeds deposited to the credit of the Receiver General, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: donated to a charitable institution; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a dairy product that is inedible, it shall be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: sold for preparation as animal food or as a non-food product and the proceeds deposited to the credit of the Receiver General, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: disposed of or destroyed.

Section.Text: In the case of a dairy product packed in bulk the following information, namely,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the numeral 1, 2 or 3 in the grade name, where the grade name is required to be shown within the maple leaf grade mark,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the numerals in the percentage declaration of skim milk powder and whey powder in the case of blended skim milk and whey powder and blended whey and skim milk powder, and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the numerals in the percentage declaration of milk fat in the case of partly-skimmed milk powder, buttermilk powder, dairy spread and calorie-reduced butter,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: shall, where it is marked on a principal display surface of an area set out in Column I of the table to this Schedule, be of the height set out in Column II of the table opposite that principal display surface.

Section.Text: In the case of a prepackaged dairy product the following information, namely,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the numeral 1, 2 or 3 in the grade name, where the grade name is required to be shown within the maple leaf grade mark,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the numerals in the percentage declaration of moisture and milk fat in the case of cheese and cheese products, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the numerals in the percentage declaration of milk fat in the case of partly-skimmed milk powder, sterilized cream, evaporated partly-skimmed milk or concentrated partly-skimmed milk, dairy spread and calorie-reduced butter,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: shall, where it is marked on a principal display surface of an area set out in Column I of the table to this Schedule, be of the height set out in Column II of the table opposite that principal display surface.

row.entry: Minimum Height of Numerals or Letters
not more than 32 square centimetres (5 square inches)
more than 32 square centimetres (5 square inches) but not more than 258 square centimetres (40 square inches)
more than 258 square centimetres (40 square inches) but not more than 645 square centimetres (100 square inches)
more than 645 square centimetres (100 square inches) but not more than 25.8 square decimetres (400 square inches)
more than 25.8 square decimetres (400 square inches)

ImageGroup.AlternateText: Outline of a maple leaf with the word CANADA and the number 1 inside.
Outline of a maple leaf with the word CANADA and the number 2 inside.

Provision.Text: NOTE: The maple leaf shall be white or of a uniform colour with the grade name of such a contrasting colour so as to stand out against the colour of the maple leaf.

Section.Text: Sections 1 to 6 and 11 of these Regulations do not apply to cheese that is made before these Regulations come into force.
The following Regulations are repealed:

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the Dairy Products Regulations18;
